> Patch Set 6:
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> I'm still trying to wrap my head around this a bit.  Does this have an associated entity-manager config format change that comes with it?  If so, please add them to the same topic.

Hi Ed Tanous,

This application doesn't require any configuration file from entity manager, this is purely based on the IPMB-Fru detection.
This change has the following implementation

1. Keep monitoring the new FRU device detected in IPMB-FRU in the below DBus path 
this Dbus can be parsed using "GetSubTreePaths"
	root@yosemitev2:~# busctl tree xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice
	└─/xyz
	  └─/xyz/openbmc_project
		└─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb
		  └─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_0
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_1
			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_2

2. If any FRU detected in IPMB using SDR commands we probe for the sensor list (Storage SDR info command [Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 33.9])
	a) In our example he have 4 IPMB-Fru devices getting detected 
	
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_0
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_1
			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_2

	b) From these Dbus properties we can get the IPMB Bus addresses 
	
3. With the received IPMB parameters we can probe the SDR sensor lists
	a) If the detected IPMB Fru does not support SDR function then we don't do anything 
	b) If the detected IPMB Fru reponse for the sdr inform command we can get the sensor list 
	
4. Execute Storage Reserve SDR command (Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 33.11)and get the response as Reservation ID. 
5. After getting Record Count and Reservation ID frame the packet for execute the Storage Get SDR command (Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 33.12)
and get the response as full information about the specific sensor details, 
it combines of sensor number, sensor name, threshold config values, sensor units etc. (Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 43)

6. Map the respective values into the specific property and create the Dbus object in IpmbSensor using the SDR type and respective sensor name.
	root@yosemitev2:/lib/systemd/system# busctl tree xyz.openbmc_project.IpmbSensor
	└─/xyz
	  └─/xyz/openbmc_project
		├─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors
		│ └─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/SDR_Type_01
		│   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/SDR_Type_01/Host_0_INA230_Power
			.
			.
			.

			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/SDR_Type_01/Host_3_SOC_Tjmax
		└─/xyz/openbmc_project/software
		  ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02
		  │ ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02/Host_0_CPU_DIMM_HOT
		  .
		  .
		  .
		  │ ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02/Host_3_Sys_booting_sts
		  └─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03
			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03/Host_0_CATERR
			.
			.
			.
			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03/Host_3_SPS_FW_Health

7. Same flow we can repeat for all the record count and same for all the detected devices 

Note: -
"xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice" IPMB FRU implementation in separate gerrit review(https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/37512).

I'm not following.  Surely we can't enable this for all IPMB devices without a config item.  Lots of IPMB enabled devices don't have an SDR.

> This change has the following implementation
> 
> 1. Keep monitoring the new FRU device detected in IPMB-FRU in the below DBus path

> 			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmb/FruDevice/Twin_Lakes_Passive_MP_2

Please don't monitor Fru device directly.  Use an entity config to instantiate the correct configuration items.  In this case, you'll likely only instantiate a "has IPMB fru" like device.

I'd like to see this done because there's surely more things we'll need to instantiate based on the IPMB FRU than just sensors, and we'll need the entity mapping for Redfish to work properly with these new sensors.

> 5. After getting Record Count and Reservation ID frame the packet for execute the Storage Get SDR command (Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 33.12)
> and get the response as full information about the specific sensor details, 
> it combines of sensor number, sensor name, threshold config values, sensor units etc. (Refer :- ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1, Section 43)
> 
> 6. Map the respective values into the specific property and create the Dbus object in IpmbSensor using the SDR type and respective sensor name.
> 	root@yosemitev2:/lib/systemd/system# busctl tree xyz.openbmc_project.IpmbSensor

> 		│   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/SDR_Type_01/Host_0_INA230_Power

FYI, SDR_TYPE_01 isn't a valid sensor type.  You'll need to map this to the appropriate dbus types.

> 			.
> 			.
> 			.
> 
> 			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/SDR_Type_01/Host_3_SOC_Tjmax
> 		└─/xyz/openbmc_project/software
> 		  ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02
> 		  │ ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02/Host_0_CPU_DIMM_HOT
> 		  .
> 		  .
> 		  .
> 		  │ ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_02/Host_3_Sys_booting_sts
> 		  └─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03
> 			├─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03/Host_0_CATERR
> 			.
> 			.
> 			.
> 			└─/xyz/openbmc_project/software/SDR_Type_03/Host_3_SPS_FW_Health

These two need different dbus abstractions.  Can we focus on getting Type 1 records supported first, then move on to how we map type 2 and 3 records to dbus?

> "xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice" IPMB FRU implementation in separate gerrit review(https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/37512).

We understand your concern, in this design we Dynamically detect IPMB device which support SDR or Not,
we can get the sensor configuration detatils from the supported device, 
so new configuration file is not required to get the sensor details.
I list the below how my design to get the sensor details dynamically.

In this logic first list all the detected IPMB-FRU device by using object mapper call of "GetSubTreePaths" method, 
and for all the detected device, request the "StorageGetSdrInfo" command. 
Based on the response if SDR is available then do the remaning processing
or it will return and check the next device and unsing this command we can
get the total sensor record count available in each device.

> I'd like to see this done because there's surely more things we'll need to instantiate based on the IPMB FRU than just sensors, and we'll need the entity mapping for Redfish to work properly with these new sensors.

Request the "StorageGetSdr" command with specific sensor RecordID it will return configuration details (Ex. Upper/Lower Critical Thresholds, Unit, Sensor Name, Sensor ID etc. ) for each sensor, based on this details dbus object will create for each sensor using Sensor name Dynamically.
After dbus object create for each sensor update the sensor value using "GetSensorReading" command.

At the very least we'll need to configure a sensor scan rate for the IPMB sensors in a config file, as well as a power state parameter.  The scan rate parameter might even need to be per-sensor, although that might have other ramifications.
